answers.q: is benzyl alcohol bad for hair
answers.a: Not inherently—at the low levels used as a solvent or preservative in hair products, it typically doesn’t damage hair, though some people may find it slightly drying or irritating to the scalp.

answers.q: is benzyl alcohol bad for skin
answers.a: It’s widely used in cosmetics and is generally safe at permitted levels, but it can cause irritation or allergic contact dermatitis in sensitive individuals (it’s a listed fragrance allergen in the EU).
Yes—E1519 is permitted as a food additive/solvent and considered safe at approved use levels; very high exposures can be harmful (notably in premature infants), and some people may be allergic.

answers.q: does benzyl alcohol dry out hair
answers.a: It can be mildly drying because it’s a solvent, but typical small amounts in formulations usually don’t cause noticeable dryness for most users.

answers.q: does benzyl alcohol dry out skin
answers.a: It may feel drying or stinging at higher concentrations or on sensitive/broken skin, though at common cosmetic levels (often up to about 1% as a preservative) most people tolerate it well.
